thread.title: Woman charged in Randolph overdose death
thread.title_full: Woman charged in Randolph overdose death - WCAX.COM Local Vermont News, Weather and Sports-

author: wcax.com
title: Woman charged in Randolph overdose death
text:
RANDOLPH, Vt. (AP) - Vermont State Police say a Randolph woman has been charged in connection with the fentanyl overdose death of a man found unconscious in a bathroom at a convenience store in April.
Tara Bent, 24, was arrested Tuesday and charged with dispensing a stimulant, depressant or narcotic with death resulting.
Police say 30-year-old Donald Farnham died of a drug overdose in the bathroom of the Randolph Cumberland Farms April 23.
Police say evidence collected at the scene determined that the drug was fentanyl, an opioid that can be up to 50 times more powerful than heroin.
Bent was being held on $25,000 bail. It was not immediately known if she was being represented by an attorney.
